titleStmt.title: Zeb Ward to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6225

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Lexington March 10/65
To his Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlett
Dear Governor

This will Introduce to you Mr Jno R. Warnock of this city -- who goes to see you in regard to a fine -- which he will explain to you in person -- I have ^known^ Warnock for many years and he is a particular friend of mine -- I trust you will find it consistent with duty to remit the fine -- Mr W. is not a man of any large means and has a large family dipinding upon him for a support who need his money much more than the state of Ky and I am quite sure that if you only knew Warnock
as I do that you would grant his request at once and trust you will any way & if any body says you have done wrong charge it to me --
